pullRequest.body:
This proves `isKilling_of_equiv`, which states that if a Lie algebra is isomorphic to a Killing Lie algebra, then it is Killing too.

This is a step towards the proof that all derivations over a finite dimensional semisimple Lie algebra are inner (see [this thread](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Derivations.20on.20Lie.20algebras)). Indeed, the proof that I have formalized relies on the fact that such a Lie algebra `L` is isomorphic to `ad(L)`, from which I want to infer that `ad(L)` is Killing.

bors merge

Please create an alias called `LieAlgebraEquiv.isKilling` which can be called with dot-notation.
```
alias LieAlgebraEquiv.isKilling := isKilling_of_equiv
```

Yes. I actually added `alias _root_.LieEquiv.isKilling := LieAlgebra.isKilling_of_equiv` to be in the correct namespace so that I could indeed use dot-notation to call it. I also renamed the section to `LieEquiv` (since `LieAlgebraEquiv` is actually not the correct name in mathlib).

```suggestion
variable {R L}
variable {L' : Type*} [LieRing L'] [LieAlgebra R L']
```

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma killingForm_of_equiv_apply (e : L ≃ₗ⁅R⁆ L') (x y : L) :
```

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma conj_ad_apply (e : L ≃ₗ⁅R⁆ L') (x : L) :
    LinearEquiv.conj e (ad R L x) = ad R L' (e x) := by
```

```suggestion
  rw [LinearEquiv.conj_apply_apply, ad_apply, ad_apply, coe_to_linearEquiv, ← coe_to_lieHom,
    LieHom.map_lie, coe_to_lieHom, ← coe_to_linearEquiv, LinearEquiv.apply_symm_apply]
```
I'll note in passing that the back-and-forth dance with `LieEquiv.coe_to_lieHom` could be avoided if we created a lemma:
```Lean
theorem LieEquiv.map_lie (e : L₁ ≃ₗ⁅R⁆ L₂) (x y : L₁) :
    e ⁅x, y⁆ = ⁅e x, e y⁆ :=
  LieHom.map_lie e.toLieHom x y
```

I suggest adding:
```lean
open LieAlgebra in
lemma killingForm_apply_apply (x y : L) :
    killingForm R L x y = trace R _ (ad R L x ∘ₗ ad R L y) :=
  LieModule.traceForm_apply_apply R L L x y
```
just beneath the definition of `killingForm` and then changing this to:
```suggestion
  simp_rw [killingForm_apply_apply, ← LieAlgebra.conj_ad_apply, ← LinearEquiv.conj_comp,
    LinearMap.trace_conj']
```

We don't need to name this:
```suggestion
lemma isKilling_of_equiv [IsKilling R L] (e : L ≃ₗ⁅R⁆ L') : IsKilling R L' := by
```

What you had was good but I couldn't help trying to golf it a bit:
```suggestion
  refine ⟨fun hx' ↦ ?_, fun hx y _ ↦ hx ▸ LinearMap.map_zero₂ (killingForm R L') y⟩
  suffices e.symm x' ∈ LinearMap.ker (killingForm R L) by
    rw [IsKilling.ker_killingForm_eq_bot] at this
    simpa using (e : L ≃ₗ[R] L').congr_arg this
  ext y
  replace hx' : ∀ y', killingForm R L' x' y' = 0 := by simpa using hx'
  specialize hx' (e y)
  rwa [← e.apply_symm_apply x', killingForm_of_equiv_apply] at hx'
```
